Basque cuisine.  An excellent overall meal, I wish that I had ordered more food.  We ordered patatas bravas, tomato and bread, sausage with apple cider, and something else that I cannot remember.  All of it was delicious, and the forgotten dish does NOT speak to the quality, there were just too many restaurants tried to remember some of what goes where.  The potato and tomato dishes were some of the best of these dishes that we had.  The sausage was a welcome variation on a lot of similar food that we had on our trip. We were in need of coffee, our server offered to "make something special"  he made cafe mocha for us.  This was not the cafe mocha that I am used to.  A deep, dark chocolate flavor, and nicely roasted coffee with cream.  A nice dessert for our meal.  Our server was friendly, passionate about the food, and attentive.
